histogram.name: Security.ClientAuth.CertificateSelectionSource
histogram.summary: When TLS client authentication is requested by the server, Chrome must choose whether to return a certificate or to abort the handshake. This histogram records how this determination was made, either as a result of user action, or as chosen automatically due to content settings. It only records when a fresh certificate selection would be attempted (and thus ignores cache hits). This histogram is recorded in SSLClientAuthObserver for user-selected outcomes and in ChromeContentBrowserClient for policy outcomes. This histogram does not cover mobile, as certificate handling is not handled by Chrome on Android nor iOS.

histogram.name: Security.DataDecoder.Image.DecodingTime
histogram.summary: Logged once for every invocation of `data_decoder::DecodeImage` and/or `data_decoder::DecodeImageIsolated`. Logs the time that has elapsed while decoding the image (typically this happens in the Utility process). The time is recorded in all the cases (including empty input which don't require actual image decoding).

histogram.name: Security.DataDecoder.Image.Isolated.EndToEndTime
histogram.summary:
Logged once for every invocation of `data_decoder::DecodeImageIsolated`. Logs the time that has elapsed between 1) invocation of DecodeImageIsolated and 2) calling the completion callback (both of these events happen in the Browser process). The elapsed time covers A) spawning the utility process, B) decoding the image, C) IPC overhead.
Note that there are 2 sets of similar metrics: Security.DataDecoder.Image.Isolated. and Security.DataDecoder.Image.Reusable. In the Isolated case a Utility process is spawned for each image decoding operation and the ...End2End and ...ProcessOverhead metrics always include process spawning overhead. In the Reusable case a Utility process may get reused when decoding a batch of images, and the ...End2End and ...ProcessOverhead metrics may or may not include process spawning overhead (the process will only need to be spawned for the first image in a batch + after the process has been shut down due to inactivity).

histogram.name: Security.DataDecoder.Image.Isolated.ProcessOverhead
histogram.summary:
Logged once for every invocation of `data_decoder::DecodeImageIsolated`. Logs the overhead of using a separate process for decoding the images by calculating the difference between ...Image.Isolated.EndToEndTime and the ...Image.DecodingTime metrics.
Note that there are 2 sets of similar metrics: Security.DataDecoder.Image.Isolated. and Security.DataDecoder.Image.Reusable. In the Isolated case a Utility process is spawned for each image decoding operation and the ...End2End and ...ProcessOverhead metrics always include process spawning overhead. In the Reusable case a Utility process may get reused when decoding a batch of images, and the ...End2End and ...ProcessOverhead metrics may or may not include process spawning overhead (the process will only need to be spawned for the first image in a batch + after the process has been shut down due to inactivity).

histogram.name: Security.DataDecoder.Image.Reusable.EndToEndTime
histogram.summary:
Logged once for every invocation of `data_decoder::DecodeImage`. Logs the time that has elapsed between 1) invocation of DecodeImage and 2) calling the completion callback (both of these events happen in the Browser process). The elapsed time covers A) spawning the utility process (if needed), B) decoding the image, C) IPC overhead.
Note that there are 2 sets of similar metrics: Security.DataDecoder.Image.Isolated. and Security.DataDecoder.Image.Reusable. In the Isolated case a Utility process is spawned for each image decoding operation and the ...End2End and ...ProcessOverhead metrics always include process spawning overhead. In the Reusable case a Utility process may get reused when decoding a batch of images, and the ...End2End and ...ProcessOverhead metrics may or may not include process spawning overhead (the process will only need to be spawned for the first image in a batch + after the process has been shut down due to inactivity).

histogram.name: Security.DataDecoder.Image.Reusable.ProcessOverhead
histogram.summary:
Logged once for every invocation of `data_decoder::DecodeImage`. Logs the overhead of using a separate process for decoding the images by calculating the difference between ...Image.Reusable.EndToEndTime and the ...Image.DecodingTime metrics.
Note that there are 2 sets of similar metrics: Security.DataDecoder.Image.Isolated. and Security.DataDecoder.Image.Reusable. In the Isolated case a Utility process is spawned for each image decoding operation and the ...End2End and ...ProcessOverhead metrics always include process spawning overhead. In the Reusable case a Utility process may get reused when decoding a batch of images, and the ...End2End and ...ProcessOverhead metrics may or may not include process spawning overhead (the process will only need to be spawned for the first image in a batch + after the process has been shut down due to inactivity).

histogram.name: Security.HttpsFirstMode.NavigationEvent
histogram.summary: Events for navigations that are upgraded from HTTP to HTTPS by HTTPS-First Mode. Recorded for eligible navigations (HTTP main frame navigations that are not allowlisted), if the profile is opted in to HTTPS-First Mode.

histogram.name: Security.HttpsFirstMode.SettingChanged
histogram.summary: Records the HTTPS-First Mode preference state when it changes for a profile. Recorded for regular profiles only (not for Incognito, Guest, or Sign-in profiles).

histogram.name: Security.HttpsFirstMode.SettingEnabledAtStartup
histogram.summary: Records whether the HTTPS-First Mode preference is enabled at profile startup. Recorded for regular profiles only (not for Incognito, Guest, or Sign-in profiles).

histogram.name: Security.JSONParser.ChromiumExtensionUsage
histogram.summary: Records the usage of the base::JSONParser's non-RFC-8259-conforming extensions when parsing JSON documents. This histogram is emitted each time an instance of non-conforming syntax is detected in a document.

histogram.name: Security.MixedForm.InterstitialTriggerState
histogram.summary: Logs when an interstitial was triggered (or would have been triggered but was not due to the currently enabled experiment mode) and whether it was a direct submission to an insecure URL, or a redirect through one.

histogram.name: Security.PageEndReason
histogram.summary: Records the reason the page visit ended (e.g., reload, tab closed, new navigation, etc.) for page loads that committed.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.AboutThisSiteInteraction
histogram.summary: Tracks interactions with the AboutThisSite feature. Recorded when PageInfo is opened and when the user interacts with the AboutThisSite row.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.AboutThisSiteLanguageSupported
histogram.summary: Tracks whether AboutThisSite is available for the user's application locale. Recorded every time PageInfo is opened.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.AboutThisSiteStatus
histogram.summary: Tracks status of AboutThisSite queries. Recorded every time PageInfo is opened and information about a site is requested.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.AdPersonalizationRowShown
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the Ads Personalization section was shown. Recorded every time PageInfo is opened.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.Cookies.HasFPSInfo
histogram.summary: Tracks whether the FPS section was shown in the Cookies subpage. Recorded every time Cookie subpage from PageInfo is opened.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.TimeOpen
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time the Page Info bubble is open before the user closes it or takes an action which closes it.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.TimeOpen.Action
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time the Page Info bubble is open before the user closes it, for cases where the user has performed an action inside it.

histogram.name: Security.PageInfo.TimeOpen.NoAction
histogram.summary: Records the amount of time the Page Info bubble is open before the user closes it, for cases where the user performed no action inside it.

histogram.name: Security.PrivateNetworkAccess.CachedResourceCheckResult
histogram.summary: Same as `Security.PrivateNetworkAccess.CheckResult`, but only recorded when the resource is loaded from the HTTP cache.

histogram.name: Security.PrivateNetworkAccess.CheckResult
histogram.summary: Result of the Private Network Access Check on a new connection. Recorded once per call to network::URLLoader::OnConnected(), which may be more than once per URL request.

histogram.name: Security.PrivateNetworkAccess.MismatchedAddressSpacesDuringRequest
histogram.summary: Recorded once per network::URLLoader instantiation. True if the request connected multiple times to different transports (e.g. for a partially-cached range request) and not all the computed IP address spaces were the same.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.GetDomainInfoTime
histogram.summary: Records the time duration that a check for the reputation status of a site spent in getting the domain info of the site on the main thread, or 0 if the domain info was obtained off of the main thread. Recorded on every check.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.GetReputationStatusWithEngagedSitesTime
histogram.summary: Records the time duration of a check for the reputation status of a site on the main thread. Recorded on every check.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.Interaction
histogram.summary: Records a user's interaction with a Safety Tip. Recorded every time a user uses one of the Safety Tip's buttons or dismisses it explicitly. Can be normalized against Security.SafetyTips.SafetyTipShown, filtered to users with the feature enabled to show the UI.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.PageInfo.Action
histogram.summary: Tracks Page Info bubble actions along with the Safety Tip status of the page.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.ReputationCheckComplete
histogram.summary: Records the Safety Tip status of a page after navigation commit or page visibility change. This is the same as SafetyTipShown, but with additional suffixes for clarity.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.SafetyTipIgnoredPageLoad
histogram.summary: Records the Safety Tip status of a page after navigation commit for a page where the Safety Tip has previously been ignored.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.SafetyTipShown
histogram.summary: Records the Safety Tip status of a page after navigation commit or page visibility change.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.SafetyTipShown_AfterFlag
histogram.summary: Records the Safety Tip status of a page after navigation commit or page visibility change. This is the same as SafetyTipShown, but records *after* the flag is checked to evaluate the impact of starts_active.

histogram.name: Security.SafetyTips.StatusWithInitiator.{SafetyTipInitiator}
histogram.summary: Records the Safety Tip status of a page after navigation commit, alongside how the corresponding navigation was initiated. Only recorded on navigations that were visible at commit time.

variant.name: SameRegDomain
variant.summary: Initiated by the same registered domain

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.NumPersistedReportsLoaded
histogram.summary: Records the number of persisted SCT auditing reports that were loaded and deserialized from disk, if SCT auditing is enabled. Invalid persisted reports are not counted. Recorded once shortly after browser startup (or when the network service restarts).

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptIn.DedupeCacheHWM
histogram.summary: Records the high-water-mark of the number of entries in the SCT auditing dedupe cache. Recorded on a timer hourly, if SCT auditing is enabled.

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptIn.ReportCompletionStatus
histogram.summary: Records the final status of an SCT auditing report, when it has been successfully received or it has run out of retries.

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptIn.ReportDeduplicated
histogram.summary: Records whether a report was deduplicated (i.e., the SCTs were already in the cache) or not. Recorded on each new report seen by the SCT auditing cache (i.e., on each connection using certificate transparency).

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptIn.ReportersHWM
histogram.summary: Records the high-water-mark of the number of pending reporters in the SCT auditing cache. Recorded on a timer hourly, if SCT auditing is enabled.

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptIn.ReportSampled
histogram.summary: Records whether a report was sampled to be sent to Safe Browsing. Recorded for each new report seen by the SCT auditing cache that was not deduplicated.

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptIn.ReportSize
histogram.summary: Records the size of an SCT auditing report that will be sent to Safe Browsing (i.e., was not deduplicated and was sampled).

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptIn.ReportSucceeded
histogram.summary: Records whether sending an SCT auditing report succeeded or not. This is recorded after we receive the headers from the server (or we stop due to a connection error).

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptOut.DroppedDueToLogNotFound
histogram.summary: Records whether a hashdance report was dropped due to not finding the log metadata for the selected SCT. Recorded once when creating a new auditing report, but before the report is sampled or deduplicated.

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptOut.LookupQueryResult
histogram.summary: Records the result of a hashdance lookup query. Recorded once per query regardless of whether the query succeeded, failed, or is a retry.

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptOut.PopularSCTSkipped
histogram.summary: Records whether an SCT selected for a hashdance lookup query was skipped because it was found on the Popular SCTs list. Recorded once when creating a new auditing report, but before the report is sampled or deduplicated.

histogram.name: Security.SCTAuditing.OptOut.ReportCount
histogram.summary: Records how many full SCT auditing reports the client has sent (i.e., after a successful hashdance lookup query resulting in kSCTSuffixNotFound). This count is tracked per-client in a pref to limit how many full reports a client can send. This metric is emitted every time this count is checked by the SCT auditing code, after sampling is performed, and only once per report (including across browser restarts). This metric is only emitted for SCT auditing hashdance users.

histogram.name: Security.SecurityLevel.DownloadStarted
histogram.summary: Records the security level of the page that initiated a download (rather than the security state of the connection to the download URL itself). The recorded security level is the level of the page the download was initiated from, not that of the download URL. This histogram is not recorded for downloads that are initiated in a new tab or window, as the security level of the initiating page cannot be tracked.

histogram.name: Security.SecurityLevel.FormSubmission
histogram.summary: Records the security level of a page when submitting a form. This histogram is recorded whenever a form submission navigation begins. The recorded security level is the level of the page the form was submitted from, not the one that the form targets.

histogram.name: Security.SecurityLevel.InsecureMainFrameFormSubmission
histogram.summary: Records the security level of a page when submitting a form on a top-frame navigation with a non-cryptographic scheme. This histogram is recorded whenever a form submission navigation begins. The recorded security level is the level of the page the form was submitted from, not the one that the form targets.

histogram.name: Security.SecurityLevel.OnCommit
histogram.summary: Records the security level of a page at the time the navigation commits. Note that the security level of a page can change after commit time, so this histogram should often be compared against Security.SecurityLevel.OnComplete.

histogram.name: Security.SecurityLevel.OnComplete
histogram.summary: Records the security level of a page at the end of the page visit (i.e., navigating away from the page, reloading the page, clicking a link, closing the tab, etc.). Note that this security level can be different than the initial security level of the page, so this histogram should often be compared against Security.SecuritLevel.OnCommit.

histogram.name: Security.SiteEngagement
histogram.summary: The final Site Engagement score (0 to 100) of a URL during a visit to a page. Recorded when the user closes the page or initiates a new navigation.

histogram.name: Security.SiteEngagementDelta
histogram.summary:
The change in Site Engagement score for a site between the page navigation committing and the user closing the page or navigating away. Recorded when the user closes the page or initiates a new navigation.
The delta is logged as a linear count in [0, 100]. To use, convert back to the original difference (in the range [-100,100]) by multiplying by 2 and subtracting 100.

histogram.name: Security.TimeOnPage2
histogram.summary: Records the time spent on the page (the time that the page was in the foreground from the start of the navigation to the page visit completing due to a new navigation or the tab being closed). This aggregates all foreground time over the entire visit (multiple times in the foreground are added together).

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.BrowsingInstance.MaxCountPerProcess
histogram.summary: The maximum number of BrowsingInstances seen in a RenderProcessHost over its lifetime. Recorded once when ChildProcessImpl::SecurityState::~SecurityState() is invoked.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.BrowsingInstanceCount
histogram.summary: The count of all current BrowsingInstances. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CORBProtection.CacheHeuristic
histogram.summary: The blocking decision CORB would have made on the response, if the request was cross-origin. Reported if the response looked sensitive under the cache heuristic (i.e. had Cache-Control: Private and Vary: Origin response headers).

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CORBProtection.CacheHeuristic.ProtectedMimeType
histogram.summary: True if the response has an Accept-Ranges header, which indicates the server supports range requests on the resource and could be used to bypass CORB. Only reported if the resource looked sensitive under the Cache heuristic and was a protected MIME type.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CORBProtection.CORSHeuristic
histogram.summary: The blocking decision CORB would have made on the response, if the request was cross-origin. Reported if the response looked sensitive under the CORS heuristic (i.e. had the Access-Control-Allow-Origin header with a value other than * or null).

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CORBProtection.CORSHeuristic.ProtectedMimeType
histogram.summary: True if the response has an Accept-Ranges header, which indicates the server supports range requests on the resource and could be used to bypass CORB. Only reported if the resource looked sensitive under the CORS heuristic and was a protected MIME type.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CORBProtection.ProtectedMimeType.BlockedWithoutSniffing.HasNoSniff
histogram.summary: True if the response has a nosniff header. If the nosniff header is not present, then CORB must have decided to block without sniffing due to a partial response, or because the MIME type was a never sniff type. Only reported on resources CORB would have blocked/protected without sniffing that have a protected MIME type.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CORBProtection.SensitiveResource
histogram.summary: True if the resource was found to be sensitive by either the CORS or Cache heuristics. Recorded for every resource CORB sees.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.CORBProtection.SensitiveWithRangeSupport
histogram.summary: True if the response has an Accept-Ranges header, which indicates the server supports range requests on the resource. Only reported if the response looked sensitive under the cache or CORS heuristics.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolatableSandboxedIframes
histogram.summary: The number of sandboxed iframes that (i) are same-site (and therefore not already process-isolated) and (ii) eligible to be process isolated if SiteIsolationPolicy::AreIsolatedSandboxedIframesEnabled() is true. A sandboxed iframe is eligible for process-isolation so long as it doesn't have `allow-same-origin` among its sandbox permissions, and it isn't an about:blank url. This metric measures the upper bound on the process overhead of isolating sandboxed iframes, namely the case where every sandboxed iframe is placed in its own process. Note that the computation of this metric is independent of the current process model. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolatableSandboxedIframes.UniqueOrigins
histogram.summary: The number of unique origins among the sandboxed iframes reported in SiteIsolation.IsolatableSandboxedIframes. Used to estimate the potential process overhead if a per-origin process model is used for isolating the sandboxed iframes instead of the (current) per-site process model. Note that the computation of this metric is independent of the current process model. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsolatableSandboxedIframes.UniqueSites
histogram.summary: The number of unique sites among the sandboxed iframes reported in SiteIsolation.IsolatableSandboxedIframes. Note that the computation of this metric is independent of the current process model. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.IsPasswordFormSubmittedInDedicatedProcess
histogram.summary: Logs whether or not a password form was submitted from a site-isolated process that's dedicated to a single site. Recorded when a password form is submitted.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ORB.BlockingReason
histogram.summary:
Logs why ORB has reached a blocking decision.
Logged for each response processed by OpaqueResponseBlockingAnalyzer.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ORB.CorbVsOrb
histogram.summary:
Logs whether ORB and CORB would take the same allow-vs-block decision. This should help assess the backcompatibility risk of shipping ORB.
Logged at the end of lifetime of the ResponseAnalyzer (i.e. after processing each response that is subject to CORB - most NetworkService responses, but also CORB-covered web bundles).

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ORB.CorbVsOrb.OrbBlockedAndCorbDidnt.Reason
histogram.summary:
Logs why ORB has reached a blocking decision.
Logged when it turned out that CORB wouldn't have blocked the response, but ORB blocked the response.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ORB.ResponseHeadersHeuristic.Decision
histogram.obsolete:
Removed in Feb 2022 / M100.
Old results are preserved in https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LkF7a-_RXg0uQQdk86FQHq7CMW5pKozPDmmbnJJRhY8/edit#heading=h.6labqs212jfn
histogram.summary:
The approximation of a route that Opaque Response Blocking (ORB) algorithm would have taken to decide whether to block the response or not. The logged value is based on heuristics that only look at the HTTP response headers, and attempt to approximate if the full ORB algorithm would need to parse the response body as Javascript (vs also reaching a decision purely based on the HTTP response headers).
Note that only partial ORB algorithm is used for logging the UMA (e.g. no multimedia sniffing and/or 206-response processing is done). This means that the results overestimate how many responses need Javascript parsing.
Logged for each final HTTP/HTTPS response processed by the NetworkService.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ORB.ResponseHeadersHeuristic.{OrbDecision}
histogram.obsolete:
Removed in Feb 2022 / M100.
Old results are preserved in https://docs.google.com/document/d/1LkF7a-_RXg0uQQdk86FQHq7CMW5pKozPDmmbnJJRhY8/edit#heading=h.6labqs212jfn
histogram.summary:
The request destination (e.g. script vs image) of a response that Opaque Response Blocking (ORB) algorithm processed {OrbDecision}.
Note that only partial ORB algorithm is used for logging the UMA (e.g. no multimedia sniffing and/or 206-response processing is done). This means that the results overestimate how many responses need Javascript parsing.
Logged for each final HTTP/HTTPS response processed by the NetworkService.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.OutOfProcessIframes
histogram.summary: The count of all out-of-process iframes. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.OutOfProcessInnerFrameTrees
histogram.summary: The count of all out-of-process inner frame trees. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ProxyCount
histogram.summary: The count of all RenderFrameProxyHosts. Recorded once per UMA ping.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ProxyCountPerBrowsingInstance
histogram.summary: The count of RenderFrameProxyHosts in each BrowsingInstance. Recorded each UMA ping, once per BrowsingInstance.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ReusePendingOrCommittedSite.CouldReuse2
histogram.summary:
Whether SiteInstances with a ProcessReusePolicy of REUSE_PENDING_OR_COMMITTED_SITE could reuse an existing RenderProcessHost or they had to create a new one. True when they reused an existing process, false when they created a new one.
(Was expired between M77 and M105 before moving on to V2.)

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.ReusePendingOrCommittedSite.TimeSinceReusableProcessDestroyed
histogram.summary: Recorded on navigations with a ProcessReusePolicy of REUSE_PENDING_OR_COMMITTED_SITE (mostly subframe navigations). Measures the time since a RenderProcessHost hosting the destination URL was last destroyed, up to 10 seconds. If no host matching the destination was recently destroyed, a sentinel value of 20 seconds is used.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.SavedOAuthSites.Size
histogram.summary: The number of currently saved sites that had been isolated due to OAuth. This is only used by Site Isolation on Android. Recorded once on browser startup.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.SavedUserTriggeredIsolatedOrigins.Size
histogram.summary: The number of currently saved user-triggered isolated sites. This includes sites where the user has entered a password while using Site Isolation for password sites (which is a currently active site isolation mode on Android). Recorded once on browser startup.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.SavedWebTriggeredIsolatedOrigins.Size
histogram.summary: The number of currently saved web-triggered isolated sites. This includes sites that were isolated due to Cross-Origin-Opener-Policy headers, which is a heuristic used for site isolation on Android. Recorded once on browser startup.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.SiteInstancesPerBrowsingInstance
histogram.summary: The count of SiteInstances in a single BrowsingInstance. Recorded each UMA ping, once per BrowsingInstance.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Browser.Action
histogram.summary: Various actions related to cross-site document blocking in the browser process, indicating whether the response was blocked from the renderer. Recorded as the response is processed in the network stack.

histogram.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Browser.Blocked.CanonicalMimeType
histogram.summary: The total count of responses that were blocked by the cross-site document blocking logic in the browser process. Recorded with a canonical MIME type when the response is blocked.
